From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To remove an existing directory in a Class C Flash file system, use the **rmdir** command in EXEC, privileged EXEC, or diagnostic mode.
Examples: The following example deletes the <directory> named newdir:
ExtraInfo: This command is valid only on Class C Flash file systems.![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/caut.gif)---**Caution** ![](/c/dam/en/us/td/i/templates/blank.gif)You can use the**rmdir** command to remove a directory that another user is currently accessing in read-only mode, for example if it is that user's default working directory. If you use the**rmdir** command to remove such a directory and a user whose current directory is set to the deleted directory then uses the**pwd** command to display the current working directory, the following error message is displayed: Cannot determine current directory.---

RelatedCmds.description: Displays a list of files on a file system.
Creates a new directory in a Class C Flash file system.
